英文法規名稱: Registration and Management Regulations for Family Childcare Services Agencies
中文法規名稱: 居家式托育服務提供者登記及管理辦法

法規內容.條文內容: Registration and Management Regulations for Family Childcare Service Agencies is resolved according to Paragraph 5, Article 26 of The Protection of Children and Youths Welfare and Rights Act (hereinafter referred to as the Act).

Childcare service agencies (hereinafter referred to as the childcare providers) provide the following types of service: 
1. The childcare service in providers’ home: The childcare providers who are commissioned by the children’s parents, guardians, or other actual caregivers, provide the childcare service at the registered childcare agencies (hereinafter referred to as agencies). 
2. The childcare service in the children’s home: The childcare providers who are commissioned by the children’s parents, guardians, or other actual caregivers, provide the childcare service at children’s home or other designated locations.

The childcare providers shall provide the following service: 
1. Providing clean, healthy, safe, and child-development-appropriate environments for childcare service. 
2. Providing children sufficient service relating to the nutrition, health care, daily living and learning, play, and social development. 
3. Providing the consultation and information about the childcare. 
4. Recording children’s daily activities and growth process. 
5. Helping handle the screening of the children development.
6. Other service relating to benefits of the children development.

The childcare providers shall abide by the following rules:
1. Considering children's the best interest as the top priority and concentrating on childcare service. 
2. Making written contracts with parents, guardians, or other people looking after children. 
3. Keeping children and their families’ personal information confidential, unless they agree or the childcare providers abide by regulations to report.
4. Taking at least 18 hours of the in-service training every year. The in-service training taken every two years shall be included more than 8 hours of Basic Life Support. 
5. Having the physical examination at least once every two years. 
6. Taking out the liability insurance on the beginning day of caring children.

The childcare providers shall not have any of the following conducts: 
1. Abusing or neglecting children, or violating related children protection regulations. 
2. Having part-time jobs or running business during the service time to affect childcare service.
3. Promoting the childcare service exaggeratedly or dishonestly.
4. Avoiding, obstructing, or refusing inspection, visits, supervision and monitoring by the authorized municipal agencies and the county (city) governments. 
5. Charging fees except the regulation stipulated by the authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments.

Childcare service including the following types:
1. Half-day childcare service: Less than 6 hours per day.
2. Day-care childcare service: More than 6 hours but less than 12 hours per day.
3. Full-day childcare service: More than 16 hours per day.
4. Overnight childcare service: Looking after children from the evening to the next morning within 12 hours.
5. Extending childcare service: Extending childcare service of four above-mentioned Subparagraphs.
6. Temporary childcare service: Temporary childcare service other than five above-mentioned subparagraphs.

The childcare providers who care for children should abide by the following regulations about the number of children:
1. Every childcare provider can look after:
(1)Half-day, day-care, extending, or temporary childcare service: No more than 4 children, among who at most 2 children can be under 2 years old.
(2)Full-day or overnight childcare service: 2 children at most.
(3)The care for 1 child of full-day or overnight childcare service: 2 children for the half-day, day, extending, or temporary childcare service, among whom at most 2 children under 2 years old.
(4)The care for 2 over 2-year-old children of overnight childcare service: 1 more child at most of half-day, full-day, extending or temporary childcare service.
2. Each of the two or more childcare providers can look after four children at most in the same agency, among which two children at most can be for full-day or overnight childcare service.
The children number in above-mentioned Paragraph is actually looked after by the childcare providers during the childcare service period. Those counted children are including the under 6-year-old children who might be the childcare providers’ sons and daughters, the childcare providers having the custody of and relative within three degrees of the childcare providers.
The childcare providers who offer service in Paragraph 1, Subparagraph 2 shall appoint the primary childcare provider to each looked after child.

The childcare providers shall apply for the childcare service registration from authorized municipal agencies and county(city) governments with application forms and the following documents: 
1. Originals of certifications for qualified health examinations taken in the past three months. 
2. Photocopies of certificates for the childcare providers, diplomas of programs, departments, institutes of early childhood development and education, household management, nursing from high school or above, or certifications of completing professional training programs for the childcare providers.
3. Copies of ID certifications. 
4. Frontal and hatless 2-inch head shots taken in the past 3 months. 
5. Originals of Police Criminal Record Certificates in the past 3 months. 
6. Originals of the self-evaluated checking lists for the childcare service environment safety. 
7. Original affidavits for applying family childcare service and original letters of consent for applications and issuances of police criminal record certificates. 
8. Lists of members living together in agencies. 
The childcare providers providing childcare service in children’s home do not attach documents designated in Subparagraph 6-8 while applying for registrations of above-mentioned Paragraph. 
Without documents in Paragraph 1, authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments will require applicants to hand those in within the deadline. Applications which are overdue will be rejected in official documents.

After the childcare providers’ registrations are terminated by authorized municipal agencies and the county (city) governments, or applications are rejected because of any condition in Paragraph 1, Article 26-1of the Act, authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments shall order the childcare providers to stop all service and mandate children referrals.

Authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments shall complete documentary reviews and on-site inspections within 2 months. The childcare providers who offer service in children’s home are not taken for on-site inspections.

Childcare service registration certificates (hereinafter referred to as service registration certificates) shall contain the following items: 
1. Name, gender, and date of birth.
2. Certificate number. 
3. Qualifications designated in Subparagraph 2, Paragraph 1 of Article 8. 
4. Addresses of agencies: Those who provide childcare service in children’s home are exempted from the records. 
5. Valid periods of certificates. 
People who offer childcare service in providers’ home shall hang service registration certificates on obvious and identifiable places in agencies.

Valid periods of service registration certificates are six years. Within three months before valid periods expiring, the childcare providers shall apply for changes of certificates from authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments by attaching documents of educational trainings designated in Subparagraph 4, Paragraph 1of Article 4 within 6 years before the deadline, along with documents stipulated in Paragraph 1 of Article 8. If overdue, service registration certificates will be terminated.

The childcare providers shall not rent, lend, or transfer service registration certificates to others. 
People who lose or damage service registration certificates shall immediately fill out application forms and related documents to apply for reissues or changes of certificates from authorized municipal agencies and the county (city) governments.

The childcare providers who change the recorded items on service registration certificates shall apply to authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments for changes by filling out applications and attaching related documents within thirty days. 
When the childcare providers change agencies to other administrative districts, they shall fill in the application forms and send to the authorized municipal agencies. The documents referred in Subparagraph 4-8, Paragraph 1of Article 8 shall be also attached. The childcare providers can offer services after receiving approvals from the authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments.
When the childcare providers offering childcare service in children’s home want to add or change agencies to other administrative districts, the childcare providers shall apply for changes by filling out applications and attaching document s in Subparagraph 4, 5 and 7, Paragraph 1 of Article 8.
Authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments shall complete reviews of applications for above-mentioned 3 Paragraphs within 30 days. 
If the childcare providers die, authorized municipal agencies and the county (city) governments should cancel service registration certificates.

Within 30 days of suspending childcare service, the childcare providers shall apply to original authorized municipal agencies and the county (city) governments by filling out applications and attaching original service registration certificates.
When the childcare providers want to resuming childcare service, the childcare providers shall fill out and attach related documents to original authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments.
After getting approval letters from authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments, the childcare providers can start to offer service.
Within 7 days of starting and terminating to care each child, the childcare providers shall report to authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments.

When the childcare providers start looking after a child, authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments shall visit the childcare providers within 30 days. The following cases can be excluded: the childcare providers offer services in children’s home and the special condition is approved by the authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments

Authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments shall complete the following inspections and guidance for the childcare service in providers’ home: 
1. The first visit: When the childcare providers look after children for the first time, authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments shall complete at least 4 visits per year. The first visit shall be done within1 month after the childcare providers looking after children. 
2. The regular visits: The childcare providers, who have looked after children for more than one year, shall be visited by authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments at least once per year. The childcare providers who offer full-day or overnight childcare service and the service designated in Subparagraph 2, Paragraph 1 of the Article 7 shall be visited by authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments at least four times per year. 
When authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments discover the childcare providers or their service agencies are fallen within one of the following conditions during the above inspections and guidance, authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments shall order the childcare providers to make improvements before the deadline. If the childcare providers can not improve before the deadline, authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments could visit the childcare providers and conduct the following treatment according to Article 70 of the Act and deal with by Article 90 of the Act:
1.No passing checking lists for childcare service environment safety. 
2.Violating Article 4, 5, 7, Paragraph 1 of Article 13, Article 14 or 16. 
3.Other situations of violating laws or injuring children’s mental and physical health.

During inspections, the childcare providers shall cooperate with authorized municipal agencies and the county(city) governments and offer the following documents: 
1. Names, genders, birthdates, childcare service methods, time, periods, main caregivers designated in Subparagraph 5, Paragraph 1 of Article 7 and written contracts of the actual children being looked after. 
2. Lists of members living together in agencies. 
3. Documents of the childcare providers’ physical examinations. 
4. Document of in-service trainings. 
5. Other necessary documents.

Authorized municipal agencies and county (city) governments, who shall reference the local price index and the childcare providers’ registered charges in the recent two years according to Paragraph 3 of Article 25, formulate and regularly announced the charging and refunding items and standards of childcare service by childcare service types.
The Regulation has been implemented from the date of promulgation.
